title: Difference between playing off meta and trolling
body:
So I wanted to address this topic since people seem to not understand it.
Off meta picks means you play a champion in a different way that the one it is supposed to be played.
Going Yasuo Adc, Lucian Jungle, Miss Fortune Mid, Lee sin support etc. is fine **AS LONG AS**
you do what the role u are playing is supposed to do.
For example, when you are top lane, running smite and following your jungler to steal their camps is not playing off meta.
When you are support, pick whatever you want, it is fine, but go bot lane, don't take cs from your ad carry, buy at least a sightstone or a default support item.
If you fulfill those you are fine playing whatever you enjoy playing.


**Context**
 I wanted to say this because of  a recent game I had.
It was a **normal game**.
My support hovered Orianna.
I was thinking that Yasuo + Ori would be a sick bot lane.
I guess she had a different idea of that. I told her we can all in level 2, and she replied she is not going to listen to a yasuo player who is "trolling", she then bought a doran's ring and started endlessly farming.
Even when we got like 8 kills on the enemy bot lane she would still call me a troll and wouldn't understand that the actual troll was her.At the end game screen I had the most damage on the game and she'd still say that I was trolling.

People seriously need to understand the difference between playing off meta and trolling.

You completely missed the point. The difference between trolling and off-meta play is the player's intent to win, not if they are playing a standard role in the standard way or not. [[Source]](http://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/2017/05/dev-diary-meddler-on-unusual-playstyles-in-league/)

> As long as you do what role u are playing is supposed to do
That just means you want people to play on-meta strategy-wise, but you don't care what champion they pick to do it. That doesn't allow for very much off-meta stuff at all. Proxy Singed, for example, doesn't do what top-lane tanks are "supposed" to do. Rather it invents a new role. 

Support players don't _have_ to buy sightstone either. Most of the time it's a good idea to buy sightstone, but if someone wants to try a super aggro strategy without sightstone, then it's not trolling (even if it doesn't work out) because there is still an intent to win from that player. He's just taking an unusual risk to try to snowball via combat stats.

Oh, and I just read your anecdote. Neither of you were trolling (maybe in chat, but not in game). Yasuo bot isn't that unfounded, and neither is Orianna, but that's not what you were trying to point out. The fact that she played as a carry rather than support doesn't make her a troll either, though. Yasuo bot tends to be highly risky, and if it falls behind, the Yasuo tends to have trouble farming. In that case, it's actually a good strategy to have the "support" be ready to play more like a carry: taking the farm that the Yasuo can't reach, and providing extra all-in power so the lane can snowball easier (not buying sightstone).

There's nothing wrong with picking a non meta champion. It's nice when it can completely shut down one lane. For example, Ekko support would be nice against non mobile bot lanes. Parallel Convergence can be an amazing roadblock if you put it behind them.
